action: I want to accurately apply for reimbursement of out-of-pocket transportation, lodging, and supply expenses
reason: To promptly recover personal out-of-pocket funds and ensure accurate accounting processing
acceptance_criteria: Expense application is only executable by authenticated users.
Only roles with expense application authority can use the function.
Application IDs are automatically numbered and unique.
Selection of expense category (Transportation / Lodging / Entertainment / Supplies / Other) is mandatory.
Payment date input is mandatory, and future dates cannot be entered.
Amounts must be numeric and support up to two decimal places.
Registration is not possible for amounts of 0 or less.
Currency units are fixed or selectable based on settings.
Receipt image upload can be set as mandatory.
Supported upload formats are JPEG, PNG, and PDF.
A maximum file size limit is configured.
Files are stored only after passing a virus scan.
Files are stored in encrypted storage.
Automatic amount extraction via OCR processing is possible.
OCR results can be manually corrected.
A duplicate receipt detection function (same date, same amount, same image hash) exists.
Linking with project codes is possible.
Linking with department codes is possible.
Registration fails upon invalid input.
Parameterized queries are used as SQL injection countermeasures.
Input values are sanitized (Anti-XSS).
Applications can be saved as drafts.
Editing is prohibited after submission (editable only upon being sent back).
An approval request notification is sent to the supervisor upon submission.
Approval flows can be set in stages (Primary / Secondary / Accounting).
Approvers cannot approve their own applications.
Operation logs for Approve, Reject, and Send Back are stored.
Reason input can be set as mandatory for rejections.
The applicant is notified when an application is sent back.
An accounting system integration event is issued upon approval completion.
API integration is processed via an asynchronous queue.
Idempotency keys are used to prevent duplicate integration.
Concurrent approval conflicts for the same application are prevented by optimistic locking.
Application history is maintained in chronological order.
Change history stores data values before and after the change.
Audit logs are stored in tamper-evident storage.
Rate limiting is applied to the API.
Communication is conducted via HTTPS.
Internal accounting codes are not included in the response.
The API is REST-compliant.
API versioning is managed.
Target response time for the application API is within 400ms.
User-facing messages and internal logs are separated upon error.
